intro: Lacmellea ramosissima var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy lacmellea, is a rare and specialized plant found in specific alpine environments. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage that helps protect it from harsh weather conditions. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
